page.title: 10MAMMALS
page.content: {Red deer The stags battle to defend herds in September. They can reach 4 feet and can weigh up to 250 pounds. The summer coat is reddish brown and in the winter it is a grey brown . When the calves are born they can be spotted by foxes or birds of prey. They are covered with spots for camouflage.Soon calves can run and then they go and join the herd and their spots soon disappear. Lots of red deer come down from the hills to graze in our area in winter. {Pine marten The pine marten used to be quite common but is now one of Britain's rarest animals.They eat birds,voles, mice and other kinds of animals including insects. Once our cat brought home a pine marten and others have been seen here.
